solution_line_template: There are {num_tables_4legs} tables, {num_sofa_4legs} sofa and {num_chairs_4legs} chairs that have 4 legs each so {num_tables_4legs}+{num_sofa_4legs}+{num_chairs_4legs} =<<{num_tables_4legs}+{num_sofa_4legs}+{num_chairs_4legs}={total_4leg_furniture}>>{total_4leg_furniture} pieces of furniture

These {total_4leg_furniture} pieces have {legs_per_4leg_furniture} legs each so they have {total_4leg_furniture}*{legs_per_4leg_furniture} = <<{total_4leg_furniture}*{legs_per_4leg_furniture}={legs_4leg_furniture}>>{legs_4leg_furniture} legs

There are {num_tables_3legs} tables with {legs_per_3leg_table} legs each so they have {num_tables_3legs}*{legs_per_3leg_table} = <<{num_tables_3legs}*{legs_per_3leg_table}={legs_3leg_tables}>>{legs_3leg_tables} legs

We have {legs_4leg_furniture} legs and {legs_3leg_tables} legs as well a {legs_1leg_table} leg on a table and {legs_rocking_chair} on a rocking chair for a total of {legs_4leg_furniture}+{legs_3leg_tables}+{legs_1leg_table}+{legs_rocking_chair} = <<{legs_4leg_furniture}+{legs_3leg_tables}+{legs_1leg_table}+{legs_rocking_chair}={total_legs}>>{total_legs} legs
